column1: However, at present it is not clear if screening for prostate cancer is helpful for most men.
Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test is a blood test that checks the level of PSA in your blood.
- But other conditions can also cause a high level, such as infection in the prostate or an enlarged prostate.
- Other blood tests or a prostate biopsy can help diagnose a cancer if the PSA test is high.
This allows the provider to check the prostate for lumps or unusual areas.
Imaging tests such as an ultrasound or an MRI do not do an accurate job of screening for prostate cancer.
PSA levels can begin to rise years before a cancer causes any symptoms or problems.
Men with a family history of prostate cancer and African-American men should have this talk at age 40 to 45.
